examples.description: assigns an instance variable @board to an array with 9 blank spaces " "
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#initialize assigns an instance variable @board to an array with 9 blank spaces " "

examples.description: defines a constant WIN_COMBINATIONS with arrays for each win combination
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe WIN_COMBINATIONS defines a constant WIN_COMBINATIONS with arrays for each win combination

examples.description: prints arbitrary arrangements of the board
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#display_board prints arbitrary arrangements of the board

examples.description: accepts the user's input (a string) as an argument
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#input_to_index accepts the user's input (a string) as an argument

examples.description: converts the user's input (a string) into an integer
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#input_to_index converts the user's input (a string) into an integer

examples.description: converts the user's input from the user-friendly format (on a 1-9 scale) to the array-friendly format (where the first index starts at 0)
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#input_to_index converts the user's input from the user-friendly format (on a 1-9 scale) to the array-friendly format (where the first index starts at 0)

examples.description: allows "X" player in the top left and "O" in the middle
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#move allows "X" player in the top left and "O" in the middle

examples.description: returns true/false based on whether the position on the board is already occupied
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#position_taken? returns true/false based on whether the position on the board is already occupied

examples.description: returns true/false based on whether the position is already occupied
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#valid_move? returns true/false based on whether the position is already occupied

examples.description: checks that the attempted move is within the bounds of the game board
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#valid_move? checks that the attempted move is within the bounds of the game board

examples.description: counts occupied positions
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#turn_count counts occupied positions

examples.description: returns the correct player, X, for the third move
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#current_player returns the correct player, X, for the third move

examples.description: returns the correct player, O, for the fourth move
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#current_player returns the correct player, O, for the fourth move

examples.description: receives user input via the gets method
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#turn receives user input via the gets method

examples.description: calls #input_to_index, #valid_move?, and #current_player
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#turn calls #input_to_index, #valid_move?, and #current_player

examples.description: makes valid moves and displays the board
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#turn makes valid moves and displays the board

examples.description: asks for input again after a failed validation
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#turn asks for input again after a failed validation

examples.description: returns false for a draw
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#won? returns false for a draw

examples.description: returns the winning combo for a win
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#won? returns the winning combo for a win

examples.description: returns true for a draw
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#full? returns true for a draw

examples.description: returns false for an in-progress game
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#full? returns false for an in-progress game

examples.description: returns true for a draw
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#draw? returns true for a draw

examples.description: returns false for a won game
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#draw? returns false for a won game

examples.description: returns false for an in-progress game
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#draw? returns false for an in-progress game

examples.description: returns true for a draw
examples.full_description: ./lib/tic_tac_toe.rb TicTacToe#over? returns true for a draw

examples.description: returns true for a won game

examples.description: returns false for an in-progress game

examples.description: return X when X won
